result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew R. Fawley in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Upon motion of the State case is dismissed and read-in. Minutes filed.
Certificate to Register of deeds for Payment of Attorney Fees for Indigent Defendant.  Covers 13CF465 and 14CF204
Atty Valerian Powell's final statement & copy of email regarding dates of service. 13CF465 & 14CF204

Final pre-trial on December 3, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew R. Fawley in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frost just appointed. Jury Trial rescheduled and cases are joined for trial (14CF204 & 13CF465). Mintues filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Andrew R. Fawley in court with attorney Valerian A Powell.  Daniel A Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed, Information filed in court. Bond remains. Motion to join. No objection. Files joined for trial. Not guilty plea entered.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Prior surety bond previously signed covers this file as well.

Defendant Andrew R. Fawley in court with attorney Valerian A Powell.  Estee E Scholtz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter put back on the calendar to clarify surety bond and defendant's status with respect to the condition that he must live with the person who co-signed the bond. Attorney Powell and defendant inform the Court that he does still live with his brother (co-signer) and was confused as to why this was on the call again. Court orders original surety bond amended to include new felony file and does not require the co-signer to come back to sign. Amended bond will cover both files. Future court dates remain on as previously scheduled. MInutes filed.

Bond must be co-signed by person who defendant will be living with. Defendant must reside at same address as co-signer. Total Bond 13CF465 and 14CF204 and SO 13-5170.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.A.H. (DOB 7-25-1998) OR K.K. OR MARISA NOR OR THEIR RESIDENCES.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
